channel.title: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)
channel.description:
i did the tutorial at [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,301832.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,301832.0.html[/url] and i run the "ALL.CMD" and it comes up... 30sec later it says PRESS ANY KEY TO CONTINUE... i open the BUILD.CMD and it says this after a few secs Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Press any key to continue . . .
i open run.cmd and while its checking for updates the cmd says error_game_js5connect
WHAT DO I DO?!?!?

item.title: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)
item.dc:creator: @ryannathans ryannathans
item.description:
@ryannathans wrote:

i have swapped to http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,327545.0.html and NOW WHAT? i use the build.bat and it says javac: file not found: loader.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .

the game says that stupid error i said before (im using the new server and client) but same error as the old one i run server THEN my client.

what ip do i use? MINE OR NO-IP?

Read full topic
item.source: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)

item.title: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Your on the right track on running your server. But run.bat or just run is the file you use to open
your server up which will turn it on. The build.bat or also called compile is the file that operates
the saved files that you may have added. Sorry about my explaining, today wasnt really a good
day for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)

item.title: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)
item.dc:creator: @ryannathans ryannathans
item.description:
@ryannathans wrote:

i seriously dunno what im doing?!?!!?!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with starting server (i followed the tut)
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Are you opening a build.bat? If you are try finding a run.bat.
Usually build means something like compile i guess, sorry i
cannot help out alot.

Read full topic
